locations.name: Postwick
locations.description: A farming town since days of old, where people and their Pokémon live in close harmony.

locations.name: Wedgehurst
locations.description: Our quiet borough is home to the esteemed Pokémon Research Lab.

locations.name: Motostoke
locations.description: An industrial city studded with steam-powered marvels of modern engineering.

locations.name: Turffield
locations.description: A town nestled within the nurturing bowl of our many terraced farming fields.

locations.name: Hulbury
locations.description: A bustling seaport that many visit to see its lively market stalls and famed restaurant.

locations.name: Hammerlocke
locations.description: A city of great history, living and thriving within castle walls that date back to the middle ages.

locations.name: Stow-on-Side
locations.description: A vibrant town that has grown up around an ancient mural tucked away in the mountains.

locations.name: Ballonlea
locations.description: A charming town where the people make their homes among the trunks of the towering trees.

locations.name: Circhester
locations.description: Buildings from an age long gone still stand about the steaming hot spring that covers the town.

locations.name: Spikemuth
locations.description: This rocking town has a punk vibe and streets crammed with shops lined up cheek by jowl.

locations.name: Wyndon
locations.description: This booming metropolis was designed and developed by our very own Chairman Rose.

locations.name: Route 1
locations.description: A quiet and peaceful country raod that connects Postwick to Wedgehurst.

locations.name: Route 2
locations.description: Professor Magnolia's research lab is located the end of this Route.

locations.name: Route 3
locations.description: A rocky path that allows easy access to the Galar Mine.

locations.name: Route 4
locations.description: This path is covered in a bed of vibrant, yellow grass.

locations.name: Route 5
locations.description: Trainers can get a great view of Galar's famous Wild Area from the top of this Route.

locations.name: Route 6
locations.description: The sunlight shines relentlessly on this part of Galar. Fossils are often found inside rocks scattered throughout the area.

locations.name: Route 7
locations.description: Travelers come to these crossroads to admire the various bridges that were build to help traverse the mountainous terrain.

locations.name: Route 8
locations.description: Split between an upper and lower path, ancient ruins dot the lower section of this road. The upper part is constantly pelted by hail.

locations.name: Route 9
locations.description: The bay here is freezing cold. Trainers should take caution when traveling over the water.

locations.name: Route 10
locations.description: Although the hike along this snowy path can be harsh, the luxurious city of Wyndon awaits at the end.

locations.name: Slumbering Weald
locations.description: The legendary Zacian and Zamazenta sleep in the altar found within this forest.

locations.name: Galar Mine
locations.description: One of the mines in the Galar region. Miners are careful to not harm the Rolycoly that blend in with normal coal.

locations.name: Galar Mine No. 2
locations.description: One of the mines in the Galar region. The pools of water attract many different Pokémon.

locations.name: Motostoke Outskirts
locations.description: This road allows easy access to the Galar Mine No. 2 for the residents of Motostoke.

locations.name: Glimwood Tangle
locations.description: The mushrooms that grow here are luminescent, making this forest appear like it is part of a fairy tale.

locations.name: Route 9 Tunnel
locations.description: This tunnel was dug to allow access between Routes 7 and 9.

locations.name: Battle Tower
locations.description: Formerly known as Rose Tower, challengers compete at the roof of the Battle Tower to win as many battles as they can to increase their ranking.

locations.name: Energy Plant
locations.description: A power plant owned by Chairman Rose, which he uses to help power the Galar region.

locations.name: Meetup Spot
locations.description: The southernmost point of the wild Area. There is a train station here where Trainers can access the various cities of Galar.

locations.name: Rolling Fields
locations.description: A large central field in the southern end of the Wild Area.

locations.name: Dappled Grove
locations.description: A forested area running along the west wall of the Wild Area next to Lake Axewell.

locations.name: East Lake Axewell
locations.description: East Lake Axewell consists of the land around the southern entrance to Motostoke, as well as the eastern part of Lake Axewell.

locations.name: West Lake Axewell
locations.description: West Lake Axewell encompasses the western half of Lake Axewell and parts of the land north and south of the bridge.

locations.name: North Lake Miloch
locations.description: The northern end of Lake Miloch, this section connects the southern half of the Wild Area to the northern half.

locations.name: South Lake Miloch
locations.description: South Lake Miloch encompasses the majority of Lake Miloch except for its northernmost arm, as well as the section of land that juts into the lake.

locations.name: Watchtower Ruins
locations.description: Watchtower Ruins forms a bluff overlooking the northwest part of Lake Axewell. The land starts low at its southwesterly corner, near the waterline.

locations.name: Axew's Eye
locations.description: Axew's Eye is a small island in the middle of Lake Axewell in the southern Wild Area, surrounded by water on all sides.

locations.name: Giant's Seat
locations.description: Giant's Seat is a stretch of land lying on the east shore of Lake Miloch. A towering spire of rock juts up from the south end near the cliff wall on the east.

locations.name: Lake of Outrage
locations.description: A small lake in the northwest corner of the Wild Area.

locations.name: Hammerlocke Hills
locations.description: This northernmost section of the Wild Area connects to the city of Hammerlocke.

locations.name: Giant's Cap
locations.description: Located in the west of the northern portion of the Wild Area. It connects to the Stony Wilderness to its south and the Hammerlocke Hills to its north.

locations.name: Dusty Bowl
locations.description: Located in the center of the northern portion of the Wild Area. Sandstorms are occasionally whipped up in this dry area.

locations.name: Giant's Mirror
locations.description: Located in the east of the northern portion of the Wild Area. There is a large pond that is highly reflective.

locations.name: Stony Wilderness
locations.description: Located in the south of the northern portion of the Wild Area. There are many giant stones.

locations.name: Bridge Field
locations.description: Located northeast of Motostoke, connecting the southern and northern portions of the Wild Area. Both the north and south ends of this fields are covered by massive bridges.

locations.name: Motostoke Riverbank
locations.description: Located northeast of Motostoke, connecting the southern and northern portions of the Wild Area. Both the north and south ends of this fields are covered by massive bridges.
